en.sc1: Inserting an element at position 0 of an array-based list requires shifting all existing elements in the array by one position toward the end.
en.sc2: Here is an array list with five elements. We will insert an element elem with value 23 to position 0 via add(0, elem)
en.sc3: We first check that position is a valid index for the elements array.
en.sc4: We also check if the elements array has enough space to hold the new element.
en.sc5: Then we shift all existing elements one position to the right to make room.
en.sc8: Because we have to shift potentially all $n$ elements to the right, the cost to insert into an array-based list is $O(n)$.
